title: Pedagogical Agent Utilization Strategy Design for Multimedia Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level Domain-Specific (Medical/Legal/Technical) Foundational Knowledge and Experience with Multimedia Learning Tools
context.additional_context: A small-scale expert-training program conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, progressing through project-based language learning while receiving continuous feedback via formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can understand complex language concepts 20% more efficiently by utilizing social cues provided by pedagogical agents
Learners can distinguish and apply at least three cognitive load reduction strategies based on the visual representation (human-like/non-human-like) and role (guide/facilitator) of pedagogical agents
Learners can improve their self-directed learning speed by more than 15% in multimedia environments integrated with pedagogical agents upon completing the 6-month course

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
